metadata.dc:author: Pastor, N
Mataix, J
Climent, J M
Silvestre, J F
Lucas, A
metadata.dc:description: Brachioradial pruritus is characterized by the presence of pruritus on the lateral aspect of the arms. The etiology of this enigmatic entity is the subject of some debate some authors claim that brachioradial pruritus is a photodermatosis whereas others attribute it to the presence of underlying cervical radiculopathy. In these case reports, we present our experience with brachioradial pruritus and discuss the role of underlying neuropathy in its etiology and that of other types of localized pruritus such as notalgia paresthetica, anogenital pruritus, and burning mouth syndrome.
metadata.dc:title: Prurito braquiorradial como síntoma de radiculopatía cervical.
[Brachioradial pruritus as a symptom of cervical radiculopathy].
